title: How To Deal With A Partner Who's Always Working
summary: Co-working is a way of working that brings together people from different companies and industries in a shared space to exchange ideas and collaborate. Here are some tips for dealing with someone who is always working. Remember that your partner’s job can be stressful, and it's important for them to decompress when they come home. Set boundaries and don’t be a martyr, even if your partner is working a lot, you still have to do your fair share around the house and with the kids.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Working too much is a problem many people struggle with \u2014 but it\u2019s even more challenging when you\u2019re in a relationship with someone who has the same work ethic. If your partner usually leaves for work before you even get out of bed, or isn\u2019t home until after you\u2019re already in bed, things can get tricky.
Working from home, flexible hours and remote working are all buzzwords in today\u2019s labor market. Companies are becoming increasingly aware that it isn\u2019t just about how much time employees spend at the desk but also about what they achieve during that time. A Gallup poll found that telecommuting or working from home is growing in popularity among professionals across most industries. Working remotely makes it easier to find jobs, negotiate schedules and live without a commute.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

You don\u2019t want to make them feel guilty or resentful if you\u2019re always prying."),mdx("p",null,"Try not to take it personally - Your partner\u2019s workload might not have anything to do with you. It\u2019s important that you don\u2019t take their extended hours at the office personally."),mdx("p",null,"Ask them if they\u2019re feeling stressed - If you notice that your partner is working more and longer than they normally would, ask them if they\u2019re feeling stressed. It\u2019s important that you don\u2019t get resentful and start resenting your partner just because they\u2019re working more."),mdx("h2",null,"Set boundaries and don\u2019t be a martyr"),mdx("p",null,"Even if you\u2019re in a relationship with someone who works a lot, you still need to set boundaries. You may end up with a long list of chores, but at least you know what you need to do and what your partner should be helping with."),mdx("p",null,"Also, don\u2019t be a martyr. If you have kids, try to give them a bath, play with them or read them a story before you start rushing around the house."),mdx("p",null,"Take breaks while you\u2019re working, even if you\u2019re not feeling stressed or overtired. You can take a break by going for a walk, taking a bubble bath or even meditating."),mdx("h2",null,"Take care of yourself physically and mentally"),mdx("p",null,"If both of you are always working and never relaxing, it\u2019s easy for both of you to become burnt out. Make sure you are taking care of yourself physically, like getting enough sleep and eating well."),mdx("p",null,"You should also be taking care of yourself mentally, which means not bottling up your feelings and letting them fester. Communicate with each other and don\u2019t let things build up."),mdx("p",null,"Taking care of yourself physically and mentally will help you avoid getting stressed out and will also allow you to be a better partner. intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Mediation is a neutral and confidential process that can help people in numerous situations. It\u2019s ideal for individuals who want an alternative to litigation or other traditional dispute resolution processes. Unlike arbitration, mediation isn\u2019t binding, which means that if you choose to continue with litigation after mediation, you will not be precluded from doing so. And while it doesn\u2019t involve a third party making a decision on your case, as in quasi-negotiation, mediation is not a fiasco or popularity contest. Rather than having another person make the final call about what\u2019s fair, mediation gives each side the opportunity to advocate for themselves and their interests while listening respectfully to the other party\u2019s concerns as well. Read on to learn more about who can benefit from mediation"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with a Partner Who's Always Travelling
The Top 10 Best Cat Breeds in the World

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Cats are mysterious creatures, it\u2019s almost impossible to know what they\u2019re thinking. But that hasn\u2019t stopped cat lovers from all over the world falling head over heels in love with these cuddly felines. Whether you like them for their beauty, intelligence or simply for their cuteness, there is no denying that cats make wonderful pets.
There are a wide range of different breeds of cat but generally speaking there are two main categories; longhaired and shorthaired cats. Within these two groups there are numerous sub-groups and hybrids with specific traits from different types of cat \u2013 check out this article to learn more about the basic types of cat!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get over a Break-Up

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In the unfortunate event that you find yourself in a situation where you need to get over a break-up, it\u2019s important to know what to do in order to help the healing process along. Break-ups are never easy, and they can be even more difficult and hurtful if it\u2019s with your first love or someone you really cared about. These tips will help get you through any heartbreak and back into a place of peace.
When you experience a break-up, whether it\u2019s from a partner, friend or family member, it leaves you with an empty feeling. It hurts so much because you placed so many emotions into the relationship that it now feels like a part of who you are has been taken from you. Even though the person who broke up with you may have been oblivious to the pain they were causing by ending things, that doesn\u2019t make breaking up any easier for anyone involved.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Stay Organized and Sane as a Busy Mom
How to Train Your Dog to Come When Called

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Do you have a well-trained dog? If not, are you looking for a way to improve? Coming when called is an essential command that most pet owners neglect. When your dog comes when called, it means he will come back to you right away and not run away or chase something else. This will help keep your dog safe, especially if he\u2019s prone to running away or chasing objects or other animals. It also helps with training and makes everyday interactions much easier than having to constantly chase after your pet.
But perhaps the most important reason why you should train your dog to come when called is because it might just save his life one day. In many cases, dogs that run away don\u2019t get lost, they are just trying to find a way back home. Therefore, knowing how to train your dog to come when called can be the difference between him coming home safe and sound or getting lost forever. And let\u2019s face it \u2013 nobody wants that!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog Not to Chew on Household Items

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Are you ready to give up chewing on household objects? How about your dog? Dogs love to chew. It\u2019s something that comes naturally for them, and there are many things you can buy or make that will help satisfy their natural instincts to chew. But as much as dogs love to have objects that they can gnaw on, it\u2019s not always safe \u2013 or advisable \u2013 to let them do it in the home. There are plenty of household items that dogs shouldn\u2019t be allowed to chew, because it could lead to potential hazards or unsanitary conditions.
Even if your dog has never chewed on inappropriate things before, a new puppy will almost certainly try out things beyond what is safe for him. How you train him from the very beginning will determine how much damage he can do if he goes after something he shouldn\u2019t. So read on and learn how to stop your dog from chewing on anything other than his own toys.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: What Are the Benefits of Mediation?
How to Deal with a Partner Who's Always on Their Phone

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Now and again, your significant other will probably spend more time with their phone than with you. After all, it\u2019s 2018, and smartphones are practically a necessity for anyone who wants to stay connected. But if your partner is glued to their cell 24/7, it can obviously become a source of tension between you two. It\u2019s natural to feel a little jealous when someone you care about spends more time texting than talking with you, after all. And this is especially true if they seem to be ignoring you while they do so.
If your partner always seems to be on their phone, there could be several explanations \u2014 from an online affair to simply being an avid social media user. Regardless of the reasons why your partner might spend so much time on their phone, though, the way that you react definitely matters. Being insecure and accusatory about something as innocent as checking messages isn\u2019t likely to lead anywhere positive, after all. Here are some tips for dealing with a partner who\u2019s always on their phone:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
